tweets.text:
What do you think of this? https://t.co/vDHUGfFSLa

@CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets https://t.co/2xpuP1Q6gt

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @WEETFEvents @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgencySW Don‚Äôt forget make a promise about when British chalk streams will be repaired and all UK rivers certified clean enough to swim in..@Feargal_Sharkey @CamLabEF @greenarteries @friends_earth

@sandwellcouncil @CanalRiverTrust @CRTWestMidlands @EnvAgency Thanks for the responses (from all involved). There seems to be a LOT of oil still. It's certainly not safe for the swans etc to be released back to it any time soon. The pools at Bumble don't look like this now...The water surface at Titford honestly looks horrendous.

The @EnvAgency are useless example 5,752.

In 2020 the EA set themselves a target of "Enhancing", 2,300km of rivers. A meaningless term much loved by the board.

They achieved 1,753km. So by their measurement they missed a totally made up, completely fatuous objective.

Ho hum. https://t.co/EBi3jF0k68

We are operating the SOWY FRC today, this is to lower levels in the Parrett and Tone to enable essential maintenance work to be undertaken at Currymoor Pumping Station. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/uvqfg0NSJ0

So @AnglianWater have been breaching their discharge permit on the River Cam since 2015. And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? 

PS. Take chalk water out of a river and replace it with treated sewage guess what? It's no longer a chalk stream, see the Upper Lea as an example. https://t.co/anhHcsCGIB

tweets.text:
Good work from @FishFarmEA and @EnvAgencyMids.

3000 river-fit barbel and chub stocked into East Midlands rivers to help recover coarse fish populations.

Just some of the work paid for by income from #rodlicence sales.

https://t.co/S9tWA2Hd4n

@Feargal_Sharkey @AnglianWater @EnvAgency Cambridge City describes all the environmental work on the banks of the Cam just not the crummy water pollution. Byron's pool has hidden environmental pollution unseen by walkers. https://t.co/ANiTLZVecu

So the @EnvAgency has published its annual report, 5 months late.

Apparently they "Have achieved a huge amount over the last year", obviously including, not a single river in England reaches 'Good' overall environmental health.

Spent ¬£1.431 billion and employed 10,229 staff. https://t.co/0aEhhtaw8p

Meanwhile back in the real world the @EnvAgency have applied for an abstraction licence.

Why? To pump water from the aquifer into a river that is, wait for it, wait for it, over abstracted by the water industry.  You can't make this sh*t up.

PS, the river is also full of it. https://t.co/1xdVY2Ozhc https://t.co/uN3GBq4qiL

urls.title: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs very easy to save a species‚Äô: how Carl Jones rescued more endangered animals than anyone else
urls.description: Without Jones, the world might have lost the Mauritius kestrel, the pink pigeon, the echo parakeet and more ‚Äì but the biologist‚Äôs methods are controversial

tweets.text: @terpsiphone @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Carl Jones at Durrell is interested in helping train and support and, he says, "learn from" them, which is great. (Anyone who doesn't know of Jones and his work might be interested in this - https://t.co/sYJyqwnoNk )

Today marks the start of the @EnvAgency's GDA consultation for the UK HPR1000 reactor. 

This is the process that all new nuclear power stations have to go through to ensure high standards of safety, security, environmental protection and waste management:
https://t.co/5Vci657U9y https://t.co/n59hwyOz3Y
@Jes_Squirrell @DefraGovUK @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @williamrworsley @ForestryEngland @NFUtweets And a decade too late.

@MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Overall am impressed with their determination & passion. Some of our most innovative & successful conservationists started with breeding animals in their back gardens - Gerald Durrell & Carl Jones to name two. I hope these lads get the support and guidance they deserve.

@EdenFisher @DefraGovUK @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @williamrworsley @ForestryEngland @NFUtweets 2040 is a decade earlier than DEFRA‚Äôs current commitment for the UK to be net Zero ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
